chapter.title: Titles
chapter.para: Title styles differ depending on where they are used. To avoid typos, consider using entities, such as &sa;, for section names that are frequently used. To be consistent, leave out trailing colons within titles if they cannot be inserted systematically.

listitem.para: For a chapter or section, use a title that provides enough context without being redundant. In a chapter titled Lists, for example, use section titles Ordered and Unordered rather than Ordered list and Unordered list.

For procedure titles, use a gerund (also known as a verb with an -ing ending), such as Writing in the example that follows. Doing so keeps the procedure name short, and distinguishes the name of a procedure from its steps that are in the imperative form.
